title: Coffee Shop Receipt
description: Achieng’ runs a small café in Kisumu. At the end of each sale, she wants a program that asks for the prices of items purchased and then prints the total bill along with tax.

title: Train Ticket Calculator
description: Kamau is building a ticket system for the Nairobi–Mombasa SGR. The program should take a passenger’s age and distance of travel, then calculate the fare (children get 50% off, seniors get 30% off).

title: Student Grader
description: Wanjiru is a teacher in Nakuru who spends hours grading. She wants a program where she enters a student’s marks, and the program prints their grade (A, B, C, etc.).

title: Password Checker
description: Otieno often sets weak passwords and forgets them. He wants a program that asks the user to enter a password and checks if it is at least 8 characters long. If not, the program should warn him.

title: Temperature Converter
description: Chebet is traveling to the U.S. and struggles with Fahrenheit vs Celsius. She wants a small program where she can type a temperature in Celsius and get it converted to Fahrenheit (and vice versa).

title: Number Guessing Game
description: Mwangi is bored while waiting in traffic. He wants a program that randomly picks a number between 1 and 100, and the user has to guess it. The program should give hints ('too high' or 'too low').

title: Bank ATM Simulator
description: Amina is designing a mini ATM system for her ICT class project. She wants a program that lets users check balance, deposit money, and withdraw money (with checks so balance never goes negative).

title: Shopping Cart Discount
description: Mutiso is setting up an online shop for farm produce. He wants a program that takes the total cost of items and applies a discount (10% if the total is over KSh 10,000).

title: Multiplication Table Printer
description: Njeri is helping her younger brother with math homework. She needs a program that prints the multiplication table of any number the user enters.

title: To-Do List Manager
description: Barasa wants a simple console-based to-do list to organize his farm chores. The program should let him add tasks, view all tasks, and mark tasks as done.

title: M-Pesa Transaction Tracker
description: Kiplagat runs a small shop in Eldoret. He wants a program that records daily M-Pesa transactions and shows the total money received and spent at the end of the day.

title: County Tax Calculator
description: Wanjiku is a boda boda rider in Nyeri. She wants a program that calculates her daily income and deducts county tax at 5%.

title: Loan Interest Calculator
description: Omolo borrowed money from a SACCO. He needs a program that calculates how much he will owe after a given number of months, based on interest rate.

title: Salary Slip Generator
description: Atieno just got a new job. She wants a program that, given her gross salary, calculates NHIF, NSSF, and PAYE deductions, then shows her net pay.

title: Matatu Fare Calculator
description: Moraa is a matatu conductor in Kisii. She wants a program that calculates the total fare collected depending on the number of passengers and distance traveled.

title: Fuel Efficiency Tracker
description: Mutua drives a taxi in Nairobi. He wants a program where he enters kilometers driven and fuel consumed, and it calculates his car’s fuel efficiency.

title: Parking Fee System
description: Njenga manages a parking lot in Nairobi CBD. He needs a program that charges cars KSh 50 for the first hour and KSh 20 for each additional hour.

title: School Fees Payment System
description: Achieng’ is a school bursar. She wants a program where parents can enter the amount paid, and it shows the remaining balance.

title: Exam Average Calculator
description: Mwikali wants to know her overall grade. She needs a program that takes marks from different subjects and calculates the average score.

title: Library Fine Calculator
description: Otieno borrowed books from the library. The program should calculate fines (KSh 10 per day late).

title: Maize Harvest Estimator
description: Chebet grows maize in Kericho. She wants a program that estimates total bags harvested based on the number of acres and yield per acre.

title: Milk Collection System
description: Koech runs a dairy farm. He needs a program that records daily liters of milk collected and calculates total income for the month based on price per liter.

title: Poultry Egg Tracker
description: Naliaka keeps chickens. She wants a program that records the number of eggs collected each day and shows the weekly total.

title: BMI Calculator
description: Amina is a fitness coach in Mombasa. She wants a program that takes weight and height, then calculates and classifies BMI (underweight, normal, overweight).

title: Hospital Queue System
description: Omondi is a receptionist at a Kisumu clinic. He wants a program that stores patient names and displays them in the order they registered.

title: Water Intake Reminder
description: Mutheu wants to stay hydrated. She needs a program that asks her weight, then calculates how many liters of water she should drink per day.

title: Karaoke Song Picker
description: Mwangi loves karaoke. He wants a program that randomly selects a song from a list whenever he types 'next'.

title: Quiz Game
description: Njeri wants to practice for her KCSE. She needs a program that asks multiple-choice questions and shows her score at the end.

title: Birthday Countdown
description: Barasa wants to know how many days remain until his next birthday. The program should calculate and display this.

title: Shopping Basket Calculator
description: Wekesa is shopping at Naivas. He wants a program that takes the prices of items and calculates the total, applying a discount if the total exceeds KSh 5,000.

title: Electricity Bill Estimator
description: Mutinda wants to budget his monthly bills. He needs a program that calculates the cost based on the number of units consumed (tiered pricing).

title: Water Bill Calculator
description: Owino lives in Kisumu. He wants a program that calculates his water bill depending on cubic meters consumed and fixed charges.

title: Football Score Tracker
description: Omondi coaches a village football team. He wants a program that records goals scored by each player and prints the match summary.

title: Athletics Timer
description: Cherono participates in athletics. She wants a program that records the time taken to run a race and compares it to her personal best.

title: Market Price Monitor
description: Moraa sells vegetables in Kisii Market. She wants a program that stores daily prices of tomatoes and onions, then shows price trends.

title: Bus Seat Booking System
description: Kamau runs a bus company. He wants a program that allows passengers to book available seats and marks them as reserved.

title: Garbage Collection Scheduler
description: Njeri manages waste collection for her estate. She wants a program that schedules collection days and alerts residents.

title: Tree Planting Tracker
description: Mutiso is part of a green initiative. He wants a program that records how many trees each participant plants and gives a monthly total.

title: Rainfall Data Analyzer
description: Chebet is a geography student. She wants a program that takes daily rainfall measurements and calculates weekly and monthly averages.

title: National ID Validator
description: Wekesa is building an app for government services. He wants a program that checks if a Kenyan ID number entered is valid (8 digits).

title: County Service Rating
description: Achieng’ wants to collect feedback about county services. She needs a program where citizens can enter ratings from 1 to 5, then calculates the average rating.

title: Polling Station Vote Counter
description: Otieno is an election clerk. He needs a program that records votes for candidates and displays the winner at the end of counting.

title: Church Tithe Calculator
description: Mutheu is a church treasurer. She wants a program that calculates tithe as 10% of a member’s income and tracks monthly contributions.

title: Mosque Attendance Tracker
description: Omar manages a mosque in Mombasa. He wants a program that records daily attendance and shows trends during the week.

title: Wedding Guest List Manager
description: Naliaka is organizing her wedding. She wants a program where she can add guests, remove names, and print the final guest list.

title: Chama Contribution Tracker
description: Wanjiru is the treasurer of her chama group. She wants a program that records member contributions and shows total savings.

title: Farm Equipment Rental System
description: Koech rents out tractors in Kericho. He wants a program that records rentals, charges per hour, and calculates total income.

title: Tea Picking Tracker
description: Cheruiyot manages tea pickers. He wants a program that records kilograms picked by each worker and calculates daily wages.

title: Fish Market Sales Calculator
description: Amina sells fish at Kongowea Market. She wants a program that records different fish sales and calculates daily profit.

title: Bus Timetable Reminder
description: Mutua commutes daily from Kitengela. He wants a program that reminds him of bus departure times and alerts him if he is late.

title: Clinic Medicine Stock
description: Mwikali manages a small clinic. She wants a program that records medicine stock, updates when medicines are given out, and alerts when stock is low.

title: Blood Donation Tracker
description: Barasa volunteers at a blood drive. He wants a program that records donor names, blood types, and quantities donated.

title: School Attendance Register
description: Wekesa is a head teacher. He wants a program that records student attendance and generates a monthly attendance report.

title: Hostel Room Allocator
description: Otieno is a hostel manager at a college. He wants a program that assigns students to available rooms and marks them as occupied.

title: Music Playlist Organizer
description: Njeri loves music. She wants a program that stores her favorite songs, allows her to add or remove songs, and play them in order.

title: Movie Ticket Booking
description: Kamau manages a cinema in Nairobi. He wants a program that lets customers book available seats for different movies.

title: Cooking Recipe Book
description: Achieng’ wants a digital recipe book. She needs a program that stores recipes with ingredients and steps, then allows her to search by recipe name.

title: Online Poll Creator
description: Mutiso runs a blog. He wants a program that creates polls with multiple options and displays results after users vote.

title: Savings Goal Tracker
description: Wanjiku is saving for a new boda boda. She wants a program that records savings deposits and shows progress toward her goal.

title: Weather Forecast Logger
description: Kiplagat is studying climate patterns. He wants a program that records daily weather forecasts and compares predicted vs actual outcomes.

title: M-Pesa Statement Generator
description: Otieno wants a program that stores all his M-Pesa transactions in a file and generates a monthly statement showing deposits, withdrawals, and balances.

title: Matatu Route Planner
description: Kamau owns a matatu company. He wants a program that stores multiple routes with stages and fares, then calculates the cheapest route for a given start and destination.

title: Secondary School Timetable Generator
description: Wanjiru is a deputy principal. She wants a program that automatically creates a weekly timetable by allocating teachers to classes without time conflicts.

title: Sacco Loan Management System
description: Chebet is the manager of a SACCO. She needs a program that keeps track of loans given to members, calculates monthly repayments, and generates reports of outstanding balances.

title: Hospital Patient Record System
description: Amina manages a private clinic. She wants a program that allows her to register patients, assign doctors, and retrieve medical history from stored records.

title: County Revenue Collection System
description: Mutiso works for the county government. He wants a program that records payments for licenses, parking, and permits, then produces daily revenue summaries.

title: Inventory Management System for a Shop
description: Barasa owns a hardware shop. He wants a program that stores products with quantities, updates stock when items are sold, and generates low-stock alerts.

title: E-Voting Simulation
description: Njeri is building a demo for electronic voting. She wants a program that allows registered voters to log in, cast their vote, and displays real-time results securely.

title: Farm Irrigation Scheduler
description: Koech uses drip irrigation for his farm. He wants a program that schedules irrigation times based on weather forecasts and soil moisture data.

title: Traffic Camera Fine System
description: Mwangi works with NTSA. He wants a program that stores car registration numbers, records speeding violations, and automatically calculates fines.

title: Kenyan Stock Portfolio Tracker
description: Omondi invests in the Nairobi Securities Exchange. He wants a program that stores shares owned, updates values based on market prices, and shows profit or loss.

title: Bus Reservation System with Multiple Buses
description: Achieng’ runs a bus company. She wants a program that manages seat reservations for multiple buses, prevents double booking, and prints tickets.

title: Kenyan Census Data Analyzer
description: Mutheu is a statistician. She wants a program that reads census data from a file, then computes population per county, gender ratios, and average household size.

title: University Course Registration System
description: Wekesa is an IT administrator at a university. He wants a program that allows students to register for courses, ensures prerequisites are met, and prevents timetable clashes.

title: Hospital Pharmacy Management
description: Mwikali is in charge of a hospital pharmacy. She wants a program that keeps track of medicines dispensed to patients, manages expiry dates, and generates usage reports.

title: Agricultural Market Price API
description: Kiplagat is building an app for farmers. He wants a program that fetches daily crop prices (like maize and beans) from an API, stores them, and provides averages per week.

title: National Exam Results System
description: Otieno is tasked with managing KCSE exam data. He wants a program that imports student results, computes performance per subject, and ranks schools by average score.

title: Online Bookstore System
description: Naliaka runs a small online bookshop. She wants a program that stores book inventory, handles customer orders, processes payments, and generates receipts.

title: Smart Traffic Light Controller
description: Mutua works on a smart city project. He wants a program that simulates traffic lights, adjusts timing based on traffic density, and prioritizes emergency vehicles.

title: Kenyan Passport Application System
description: Amina works in the immigration department. She wants a program that allows applicants to register, upload documents, and tracks application status until approval.

title: Secure M-Pesa Backup System
description: Otieno wants a program that saves his daily M-Pesa transactions into a local file but encrypts the file using AES so that no one else can read it without a password.

title: Weather Data Downloader
description: Chebet is building a farming app. She wants a program that connects to a public weather API, downloads the forecast for her county, and stores it in a CSV file.

title: Encrypted Student Report System
description: Wanjiru is a teacher who prepares student reports. She wants a program that writes each student’s report card to a file and encrypts the file before emailing it.

title: Secure File Sharing Between Offices
description: Mutiso works for a county office. He wants a program that allows sending files over the network between branches and encrypts them during transfer.

title: Hospital Patient Data Backup
description: Amina manages a private hospital. She wants a program that automatically writes patient records to a backup file daily and encrypts it before uploading to a secure server.

title: Matatu GPS Location Broadcaster
description: Kamau owns a fleet of matatus. He wants a program that sends the live GPS location of each matatu to a central server every 10 seconds for tracking.

title: Online Exam Submission System
description: Mwikali is setting up online exams. She wants a program where students submit answers over the network, and the answers are saved into encrypted files on the server.

title: Kenya Power Smart Meter Logger
description: Mutua works at Kenya Power. He wants a program that collects data from smart meters via a network connection, logs usage into files, and encrypts customer data for security.

title: Encrypted Chama Communication App
description: Njeri is part of a chama group. She wants a program that allows members to send text messages over the network, but all messages should be encrypted before sending.

title: File-Based Voting System with Encryption
description: Omondi is developing a demo for electronic voting. He wants a program where votes are sent over the network, stored in files, and each file is encrypted for security.

title: Distributed Matatu Tracking System
description: Kamau owns a large fleet of matatus across Nairobi. He wants a distributed system where each matatu sends its GPS location to a central server, which updates a live dashboard accessible via a REST API.

title: Blockchain-Based Land Registry
description: Otieno works at the Ministry of Lands. He wants a blockchain-based Java application that records land ownership transactions securely and allows verification via a public ledger API.

title: Real-Time Stock Exchange Simulator
description: Omondi is teaching finance students. He wants a multi-threaded Java program that simulates the Nairobi Securities Exchange with concurrent buyers and sellers, updating prices in real-time.

title: AI-Powered Crop Disease Detector
description: Chebet is an agricultural researcher. She wants a Java program that integrates with a machine learning model to analyze crop images uploaded by farmers, then returns predictions via a REST API.

title: National Health Records System
description: Amina is part of a government ICT team. She wants a Java application that integrates with a database cluster to store patient records, synchronizes across hospitals, and provides secure access with role-based authentication.

title: Smart Traffic Simulation with Multithreading
description: Mutua is designing a smart city project. He wants a multi-threaded Java program that simulates hundreds of cars moving through Nairobi’s intersections, controlled by adaptive traffic lights that minimize congestion.

title: Kenyan Census Big Data Processor
description: Wanjiru works with KNBS. She wants a Java program that processes massive census datasets using Hadoop/Spark APIs, computes population statistics per county, and outputs the data in dashboards.

title: High-Performance M-Pesa Fraud Detection System
description: Kiplagat is developing a fraud monitoring tool. He wants a Java application that consumes transaction streams in real-time using Apache Kafka, applies fraud detection rules, and raises alerts.

title: Distributed University E-Learning Platform
description: Mwikali is setting up an online university platform. She wants a Java system that supports video streaming, handles thousands of concurrent users with load balancing, and provides APIs for exams and grading.

title: End-to-End Encrypted Messaging Service
description: Njeri is building a Kenyan alternative to WhatsApp. She wants a Java system that supports real-time chat with WebSockets, stores chat history in distributed databases, and uses RSA + AES for end-to-end encryption.
